byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and MAÏA de la BAUME
byline.contributor: William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Dominique Strauss-Kahn escapes criminal charges of attempted rape for second time this year, despite what prosecutors in France said was evidence of sexual assault; Strauss-Kahn's own testimony regarding his 2003 encounter with French writer Tristane Banon provided evidence of sexual assault, but prosecutors say, given three-year statute of limitations on that charge, no case would be brought.
snippet: For the second time this year, Dominique Strauss-Kahn escaped criminal charges of attempted rape, despite what prosecutors in France said was evidence of sexual assault.
lead_paragraph: For the second time this year, Dominique Strauss-Kahn escaped criminal charges of attempted rape, despite what prosecutors in France said was evidence of sexual assault.

headline.main: Strauss-Kahn Is Not Charged in French Case
headline.print_headline: Strauss-Kahn Is Not Charged In French Case
